Olivia knows that while her location will change when she goes to school, she will continue to seek out opportunities to volunteer where she can. We‚Äôre so grateful for Olivia‚Äôs dedication to our community, and we look forward to seeing what she does next!

Exceeding all expectations, More students realized how much impact repairing and building homes had in their neighbors' lives. For Olivia, it was everything to know that they "were doing all they can to provide a dream of ours‚Äì a dream where everyone has a place to call home."

Working closely with Northern Ocean Habitat for Humanity, where she interned, Olivia organized builds for veteran communities and other communities in need, learning and teaching skills like caulking windows to repair homes and build new ones. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FVUQroaXoAAzzPL.jpg

When she first entered high school, Olivia quickly joined the Habitat for Humanity Campus Chapter. Today, Olivia is the Chapter President and has helped grow the club from 12 people to over 90 recurring volunteers.

In her early days with Habitat, Olivia remembers being stunned by the grit and persistence of the families she met. Being able to see the difference one home makes in a family's trajectory, she knew she wanted to continue to work with Habitat for Humanity. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FVUQrX7WIAMIRtj.jpg

The more homeowners she spoke with, the more Olivia understood the power of having a safe home and just how much impact she could have working with veterans like her Father, who selflessly signed up to serve our country.

Olivia, who first began volunteering with Northern Ocean Habitat for Humanity when she was 13, was first inspired to serve when she learned about the high rate of veteran poverty and housing insecurity among Ocean County veterans.

Northern Ocean Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit doing what it can to build a world where everyone has a comfortable and safe place to call home. They rely on volunteers like Olivia to make home ownership a reality one family at a time. https://www.habitat.org/us-nj/toms-river/northern-ocean-hfh
